Class Building

java.lang.Object
  Building
public class Building
extends Object

This class represents a simple two-dimensional building in the Missile Command game world.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Tobias Salem, alias Vassago

Constructor Summary
Building()
          Creates a new Building instance with everything set to their default values.
Building(Vector2D topLeft, Vector2D bottomRight)
          Creates a new instance of the building with everything set to their default value except the vectors describing the top left and bottom right corners.

Constructor Detail

Building

public Building()
Creates a new Building instance with everything set to their default values.

Building

public Building(Vector2D topLeft,
                Vector2D bottomRight)
Creates a new instance of the building with everything set to their default value except the vectors describing the top left and bottom right corners. These vectors are given the valyes passed as arguments.

Parameters:
topLeft - vector representing the top left of the building
bottomRight - vector representing the bottow right of the building
Method Detail

getTopLeft

public Vector2D getTopLeft()
Get the object that defines the top left corner of the building.

Returns:
vector representing the top left corner of the building

setTopLeft

public void setTopLeft(Vector2D topLeft)
Set the the location of the top left corner of the building to the argument without duplicating the argument. The coordinate should be specified from the user's perspective, i.e., under the assumption that the game window is Quadrant 1 in the usual Cartesian plane with the origin at the lower left corner.

Parameters:
topLeft - vector which should represent the top left corner of the building

getBottomRight

public Vector2D getBottomRight()
Returns the point object that defines the bottom right corner of the building

Returns:
vector representing the bottom right corner of the building

setBottomRight

public void setBottomRight(Vector2D bottomRight)
Set the location of the bottom right corner of the building to the argument without duplicating the argument. The coordinate should be specified from the user's perspective, i.e., under the assumption that the game window is Quadrant 1 in the usual Cartesian plane with the origin at the lower left corner.

Parameters:
bottomRight - vector which should represent the bottom right corner of the building

getHealth

public float getHealth()
Returns the current health of this building. The value will be between 0 and 1, inclusive. A value of 0 indicates that the building is destroyed.

Returns:
floating point value representing the health of the building

setHealth

public void setHealth(float health)
Sets the current health value of the building. The health value must be between 0 and 1, inclusive. If an invalid value is passed the health will automatically be assigned the value of 0.

Parameters:
health - the health value which should be assigned to the building

getRepairRate

public float getRepairRate()
Returns the repair rate of this building. The repair rate will be between 0 and 1, inclusive.

Returns:
the repair rate of this building.

setRepairRate

public void setRepairRate(float repairRate)
Sets the repair rate of this building. The repair rate must be between 0 and 1, inclusive. Everytime the building is repaired, the health is increased by the repair rate. If an invalid repair rate is given then the repair rate is set to 0.

Parameters:
repairRate - the new repair rate of this building

damage

public void damage(float damageAfflicted)
Damages this building by the given amount. If the building's health falls below 0, then it is set at 0.

Parameters:
damageAfflicted - the damage afflicted to this building

isDestroyed

public boolean isDestroyed()
Checks if the building is destroyed

Returns:
true if the health of the building is equal or below 0, false otherwise

repair

public void repair()
Repairs the building by increasing the health of the building by the repair rate. If the health exceeds 1 it is set to 1.

isInterior

public boolean isInterior(Vector2D v)
Checks if the given vector is interior to the building.

Parameters:
v - a non null vector to check against the building
Returns:
true if the given vector is interior to the building, false otherwise
